intro: Webera polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited Webera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy, red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
